contextId.information: This refers to wicked people in general. AT: "wicked people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_genericnoun]])
This refers here to  wicked people in general. AT: "the wicked person" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_genericnoun]])
The word "He" refers to the wicked person, and to wicked people in general.  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_genericnoun]])
This can be stated so that it refers to anyone who suffers. AT: "those who suffer ... from them ... those who are suffering cried" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_genericnoun]])
contextId.quote: the suffering of the afflicted one ... from him ... the afflicted one cried

contextId.information: Here "He" does not refer to a specific person. AT: "Those who have ... who have ... and have not" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_genericnoun]])
contextId.quote: He who has ... who has ... and has not

contextId.information: The word "he" does not refer to a specific person. It refers to the ones with pure hearts mentioned in previous verse. The abstract noun "blessing" can be stated as a verb. AT: "Yahweh will bless them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_genericnoun]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: He will receive a blessing from Yahweh

contextId.information: This does not refer to a specific man, but to wicked people in general. AT: "the wicked people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_genericnoun]])
This does not refer to a specific person. It is a general statement. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_genericnoun]])
This does not refer to a specific person. It is a general statement. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_genericnoun]])
The phrase "the righteous" refers to righteous people in general. AT: "Righteous people will rejoice when they see" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_genericnoun]])
contextId.quote: The righteous will rejoice when he sees

contextId.information: Here "man" refers to people in general. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_genericnoun]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_gendernotations]])
